import re
e,_,*v=open(0)
e=re.sub('(\d+)(\w)',r'\1*\2',e)
for c in v:v,i=c.strip().split(' = ');e=e.replace(v,i)
print(eval(e))

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: can be done with eval and exec too:
equation = input()
equation2 = ''
for i,l in enumerate(equation):
    if l.isdigit() and i<len(equation)-1 and equation[i+1].isalpha():equation2+=l+'*'
    else:equation2+=l
constants = int(input())
for i in range(constants):
    value = exec(input())
print(eval(equation2))

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That was fun to play. The way I did it wasn't like your solution, I used (in python) eval func after replacing the letters so it was quick and could be done easily in clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was a nice parsing challenge, congrats!
I took too long but I am new to parsing and did not use regular expressions so I guess it is really possible to do it much faster than I did.
a bit confusing because the goal is not to solve, but to evaluate an expression. maybe you can rephrase a bit
This is true, I was expecting the presence of an '=' symbol in the expression as well, and having to find the value of one or more unknowns.
